content.webTitle: Roy Greenslade: Brighton Argus poster announces death of King Alfred

fields.headline: Stop press: Alfred the Great has died
fields.bodyText: If there was an award for contents bills - and why isn't there one? - then this latest offering from the Brighton Argus would surely win some sort of prize. Has the paper just discovered the death of the cake-burning Anglo-Saxon monarch? Indeed not. It refers to a story revealing that plans to replace Hove's King Alfred leisure centre with an avant-garde building designed by Frank Gehry have run out of time. For the record, Alfred the Great is reputed to have died in 899.
